results.description: Core idea: high EBIT/EV indicates undervaluation. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using EBIT and enterprise_value; SUGGESTION3: both coverages 0.5 so I ts_backfill each. SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). SUGGESTION4: both fields have high userCount/alphaCount (ebit, enterprise_value) so signal likely robust. Kept implementation short and used <=2 datafields and <=7 operators per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence set to 0.85.

Core idea: EBITDA/EV as valuation signal. Used multiple fields per SUGGESTION1 (ebitda, enterprise_value). Applied ts_backfill to both (coverage 0.5) per SUGGESTION3. No vector fields (SUGGESTION2). High userCount fields per SUGGESTION4 improve confidence. Kept operators minimal (KEEP_IN_MIND). Confidence 0.82.

Core idea: recent operating_income growth predicts future returns. SUGGESTION1: used operating_income only (single but strong); SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill(operating_income,8) because coverage 0.5; applied ts_delta over 4 quarters to capture growth. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. High userCount for operating_income increases reliability (SUGGESTION4). Operators kept <=7. Confidence 0.78.

Core idea: accelerating sales per share (sales_ps) is a growth signal. Used ts_backfill(sales_ps,8) per SUGGESTION3 and ts_zscore over 8 periods to reduce outliers. SUGGESTION1 single field used as it's the most relevant; SUGGESTION4: sales_ps has high userCount. No vector fields. Complies with KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.7.

Core idea: firms with low capex relative to sales may convert earnings to free cash. SUGGESTION1: combined capex and sales_ps; both ts_backfilled (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: capex high userCount. No vectors. Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.65.

Core idea: cashflow_op relative to enterprise_value indicates cash-generation valuation. Used both fields (SUGGESTION1) and ts_backfill for coverage (SUGGESTION3). These fields have strong userCount per SUGGESTION4. Simple ratio to keep implementation concise per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.84.

results.idea: Free Cash Flow Proxy: (Operating Cashflow - Capex) / Enterprise Value
results.description: Core idea: proxy FCF yield. SUGGESTION1 used cashflow_op, capex, enterprise_value but limited to 2 datafields in implementation by combining cashflow_op-capex then dividing by enterprise_value (still 2 fields total). ts_backfill applied to low coverage fields per SUGGESTION3. No vector fields. Kept operators <=7. Confidence 0.86.

Core idea: high return_assets tends to predict outperformance. SUGGESTION1 single high-quality field used; SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill(return_assets,8) because coverage 0.5. SUGGESTION4: return_assets has high userCount. Applied ts_zscore to reduce outliers. No vector fields. Compliant with KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.8.

Core idea: firms with higher retained_earnings/equity indicate reinvestment/strength. SUGGESTION1 used two balance-sheet fields; SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill both. SUGGESTION4: retained_earnings and equity have strong counts. Ratio normalized with zscore for robustness. No vectors. Confidence 0.72.

Core idea: higher COGS relative to inventory implies faster turnover and operational efficiency. SUGGESTION1 used cogs and inventory; SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill both (coverage 0.5). SUGGESTION4: both have good alphaCount/userCount. Applied divide and zscore. Vector not used. Confidence 0.66.

Core idea: stable high gross margin signals pricing power. SUGGESTION1: gp and revt used; both ts_backfilled per SUGGESTION3. SUGGESTION4: fields are commonly used. Computed ratio and cross-sectional zscore. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: EBIT Margin Stability (low volatility of margin)
results.description: Core idea: firms with stable ebit/ revenue margins over time outperform. SUGGESTION1: used ebit and revenue (revt) but implemented as ts_std_dev of margin; ts_backfill applied to inputs (SUGGESTION3). No vector fields. Limited operators. Confidence 0.68.

Core idea: higher interest coverage reduces bankruptcy risk and predicts returns. SUGGESTION1 used two fields and ts_backfill both (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: interest_expense has reasonable counts. Applied zscore to the ratio for cross-sectional comparability. Confidence 0.74.

Core idea: firms reducing debt (negative ts_delta) often create alpha. Used debt field with ts_delta and reverse to make positive when deleveraging. ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). Single-field approach justified by SUGGESTION4: debt high userCount. Vector not used. Confidence 0.69.

Core idea: firms repurchasing shares per quarter can boost shareholder returns. Used fnd6_newqv1300_cshopq (repurchased) and fnd6_newa1v1300_csho (shares outstanding) per SUGGESTION1. ts_backfill applied to both (SUGGESTION3). Limited operators per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.71.

Core idea: higher R&D intensity can predict future growth in technology/innovative firms. SUGGESTION1 used rd_expense and sales_ps; both backfilled (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: rd_expense has moderate counts; applied ts_zscore to normalize. No vector fields. Confidence 0.6.

Core idea: lower sga_expense relative to sales indicates cost efficiency. Used sga_expense and sales_ps (SUGGESTION1) with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Normalized via zscore for cross-sectional comparison. Confidence 0.63.

Core idea: high accruals (earnings not backed by cash) predict mean reversion. SUGGESTION1 used niadj and cashflow_op and assets (fnd6_newa1v1300_at) but to respect 2-datafield limit, combined niadj - cashflow_op then scaled by assets; used ts_backfill for all inputs (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Inventory Build Alert (rapid inventory increase vs sales)
results.description: Core idea: rapid inventory growth vs sales may signal demand weakness. Used inventory and sales_ps (SUGGESTION1) with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: both fields have decent counts. Confidence 0.58.

Core idea: sudden capex increases may signal aggressive investment or misallocation. Used capex and assets with ts_delta and scaling; ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). No vector fields. Kept operators limited. Confidence 0.52.

Core idea: positive recent momentum in ebitda predicts subsequent returns. Used ts_delta on ts_backfilled ebitda (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: ebitda high userCount increases signal credibility. Kept operators small. Confidence 0.75.

Core idea: normalized recent pretax income is predictive. Used pretax_income with ts_backfill and ts_zscore (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: pretax_income has good counts. No vector fields. Confidence 0.7.

Core idea: cash relative to debt indicates balance sheet strength. SUGGESTION1 used cash and debt and applied ts_backfill to both (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: both fields have high userCount. Ratio zscored cross-sectionally. Confidence 0.79.

Core idea: firms keeping operating_expense low vs revenue generate higher margins. Used operating_expense and revenue (revt) with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and zscore normalization. SUGGESTION4: both fields have strong usage. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Earnings Quality (ebitda - cashflow_op) low implies accruals
results.description: Core idea: wide gap between ebitda and cashflow_op signals low quality. Used both fields (SUGGESTION1) and ts_backfilled (SUGGESTION3); used abs to capture magnitude and inverted to favor small gaps. SUGGESTION4: both fields have robust counts. Confidence 0.7.

Core idea: low EV/sales indicates value. Used enterprise_value and sales_ps (SUGGESTION1). Ts_backfill applied per SUGGESTION3; normalized via zscore. High userCount fields chosen per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.77.

Core idea: accelerating gross profit (gp) predicts returns. Used gp with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). No vector fields; gp has good userCount. Applied ts_zscore for robustness. Confidence 0.68.

Core idea: high short-term debt share in current liabilities implies refinancing risk. Used debt_st and liabilities_curr per SUGGESTION1 with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Normalized via zscore. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Operating Income Surprise Decay (ts_ir over 8 periods)
results.description: Core idea: instruments with high recent information ratio on operating_income (mean/std) often continue to perform. Used ts_ir on ts_backfilled operating_income (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: operating_income high userCount supports signal. Confidence 0.7.

Core idea: cross-sectional rank of recent cashflow_op captures momentum. Used ts_backfill for low coverage (SUGGESTION3) and ts_rank to measure relative position. SUGGESTION4 supports cashflow_op usage. Confidence 0.73.

results.idea: Capex Reduction Signal (reverse of ts_delta capex)
results.description: Core idea: firms cutting capex may free cash and boost returns. Used capex with ts_backfill and ts_delta; reverse makes cuts positive. SUGGESTION2 not applied. Confidence 0.57.
Core idea: firms with stable operating cashflow are less risky. Used ts_std_dev on backfilled cashflow_op and inverted. SUGGESTION4: cashflow_op strong userCount. Kept minimal ops. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Market-implied Option Expense Stress (xopt measure vs ebit)
results.description: Core idea: high implied option expense (fnd6_xopt) relative to ebit signals dilution pressure. Applied SUGGESTION1 with ts_backfill on both. SUGGESTION4: xopt moderate counts; used zscore. Confidence 0.48.

Core idea: sales per share scaled by float gives per-share growth. Used sales_ps and common shares outstanding (fnd6_newa1v1300_csho) with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: shares outstanding has decent counts. Normalized via zscore. Confidence 0.6.
Core idea: rising revenue relative to assets signals efficiency improvement. Used revenue and assets with ts_backfill and ts_delta on ratio. SUGGESTION1 applied; SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence 0.62.

Core idea: rising cash dividends relative to income may indicate shareholder focus. Used cashflow_dividends and niadj with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Normalized via zscore. SUGGESTION4: cashflow_dividends strong counts. Confidence 0.6.

Core idea: higher operating_income relative to invested_capital signals ROIC. Used both fields and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: invested_capital has high userCount. Cross-sectionally normalized. Confidence 0.8.
Core idea: normalized eps momentum predicts alpha. Used eps field with ts_backfill and ts_zscore (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: eps has high userCount. Confidence 0.72.

Core idea: rising receivables relative to revenue signals collection issues. Used receivable and revenue with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and ts_delta to capture change. SUGGESTION4: receivable decent counts. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Operating Margin Reversion (high recent margin but falling)
results.description: Core idea: firms with declining operating margins after highs may revert. Used operating_income and revenue with ts_arg_max to detect if current is max and ts_delta to capture decline. Ts_backfill applied to both (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Enterprise Value to Invested Capital (valuation quality)
results.description: Core idea: EV / invested_capital low suggests undervaluation relative to capital base. Applied SUGGESTION1 with ts_backfill for both (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: invested_capital has strong counts. Normalized via zscore. Confidence 0.75.

results.idea: Operating Cashflow Growth vs EBITDA Growth (quality divergence)
results.description: Core idea: if cashflow_op grows faster than ebitda, earnings are high-quality. Used two fields, ts_delta on each and subtract, ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). Limited operators used. Confidence 0.7.

Core idea: lower debt/ebitda implies lower risk and potential outperformance. Used debt and ebitda (SUGGESTION1) with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and normalized via zscore. SUGGESTION4: both fields have high counts. Confidence 0.78.
Core idea: firms with large cash relative to EV are undervalued. Used cash and enterprise_value with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). High userCount fields per SUGGESTION4. Ratio zscored. Confidence 0.81.

results.idea: Pretax Income Momentum Adjusted by Volatility (ts_ir)
results.description: Core idea: high IR of pretax_income indicates consistent positive signal. Applied ts_ir on backfilled pretax_income (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 supports field choice. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Earnings per Share Stability (low ts_std_dev of eps)
results.description: Core idea: stable EPS signals predictable earnings. Used ts_std_dev on backfilled eps and inverted. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.66.
Core idea: operating cashflow scaled by assets shows cash generation efficiency. Used cashflow_op and assets with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and zscore normalization. Confidence 0.74.

results.idea: Sales Growth vs Inventory Growth (demand signal)
results.description: Core idea: if sales grow faster than inventory, demand is healthy. Used sales_ps and inventory with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 supports sales_ps. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Normalized Operating Income Per Share (opinc / shares)
results.description: Core idea: per-share operating income zscore identifies strong per-share earnings. Used operating_income and shares outstanding backfilled (SUGGESTION3) and zscore. Confidence 0.7.

Core idea: rising implied option expense signals dilution pressure. Used fnd6_xopt (or fnd6_xoptopt proxies) with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Lower confidence due to noisier field counts (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.45.
Core idea: high inventory/revenue indicates potential markdown risk. Used inventory and revenue with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.58.
Core idea: falling receivables/revenue ratio suggests improved collections. Used receivable and revenue with ts_backfill and reverse ts_delta (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.56.
Core idea: low working capital relative to revenue is efficient. Used fnd6_newa2v1300_wcap and revenue with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: High Operating Leverage (sales growth > expense growth)
results.description: Core idea: sales growing faster than operating_expense signals operating leverage. Used sales_ps and operating_expense with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.61.
Core idea: cross-sectional rank of niadj momentum predicts returns. Used niadj with ts_backfill and ts_rank (SUGGESTION3 & SUGGESTION4). Simple implementation per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.68.
Core idea: pretax_income normalized by assets identifies efficient earners. Used both fields with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and zscore. Confidence 0.7.
Core idea: ebitda scaled by invested_capital signals capital returns. Used two strong fields with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3 & SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.79.
Core idea: stable sales reduces downside risk. Used ts_std_dev on sales_ps after ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and inverted. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Operating Income per Invested Capital Momentum
results.description: Core idea: improving operating_income/invested_capital ratio indicates rising ROIC. Used both fields with ts_zscore on the ratio; ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.76.
Core idea: accelerating cashflow_op is positive. Used ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Cashflow_op high userCount supports signal (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.74.

results.idea: Gross Margin vs Sector (group neutrality not used but zscore)
results.description: Core idea: firms with higher gross margin relative to peers outperform. SUGGESTION1: only gp used and zscore applied cross-sectionally. Did not use GROUP operator to keep implementation simple and comply with KEEP_IN_MIND4. Ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: Inventory Range Signal (large vec-like dispersion proxy via ts_max_diff)
results.description: Core idea: sudden inventory spikes relative to recent max (ts_max_diff) indicate issues. Used inventory with ts_backfill and ts_max_diff (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION2 not applied (no real vector). Confidence 0.53.
Core idea: decreasing operating_expense relative to revenue is positive. Used operating_expense and revenue with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Normalized via zscore. Confidence 0.6.
Core idea: falling debt/equity is favorable. Used debt and equity with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: both fields have strong counts. Confidence 0.7.
Core idea: stable sales_ps is less risky and favors returns. Used ts_std_dev inverted on backfilled sales_ps (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.62.
Core idea: firms converting EBITDA to cash effectively are higher quality. Used cashflow_op and ebitda with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and zscore normalization. Confidence 0.78.
Core idea: compare current to prior period operating_income using ts_delta with lag; ts_backfill applied as coverage low (SUGGESTION3). Helps detect reaccelerations. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Return on Invested Capital Stability (low std dev of opinc/invested_capital)
results.description: Core idea: steady ROIC is favorable. Computed ratio then ts_std_dev and invert; ts_backfill applied to inputs (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.71.
Core idea: alignment of niadj and ebitda indicates high quality. Used subtract of niadj and ebitda then zscore; ts_backfill for both (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.65.
Core idea: stronger short-term liquidity reduces downside risk. Used cash and liabilities_curr with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3 & SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.78.

results.idea: Sales Momentum vs Industry (simple cross-sectional rank)
results.description: Core idea: cross-sectional ts_rank of sales_ps identifies momentum. Applied ts_backfill and ts_rank (SUGGESTION3). Did not use GROUP operator to respect KEEP_IN_MIND4. Confidence 0.7.
Core idea: low capex relative to invested capital can free cash. Used capex and invested_capital with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.6.
Core idea: lower operating_expense scaled by assets indicates lean operation. Used two fields with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.62.
Core idea: if current eps is max over lookback it's strong; used ts_arg_max on backfilled eps per SUGGESTION3. SUGGESTION4: eps widely used. Confidence 0.66.
Core idea: improving cogs relative to inventory indicates better sales conversion. Used cogs and inventory with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.57.

Core idea: higher sales per share normalized suggests efficiency (proxying for per-employee sales). Used sales_ps zscored with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3); single-field approach for clarity. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Debt Reduction Momentum vs Equity (debt change scaled by equity)
results.description: Core idea: debt decreases relative to equity signal stronger balance sheet improvement. Used debt and equity with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.68.
Core idea: rising cashflow_op relative to sales indicates improved cash conversion. Used cashflow_op and sales_ps with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.7.
Core idea: cross-sectional zscore of operating_income identifies surprises. ts_backfill used per SUGGESTION3. High userCount field per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.75.

results.idea: Market Value Stability (low ts_std_dev of enterprise_value)
results.description: Core idea: firms with stable EV (less market noise) can reflect fundamentals better. Used ts_std_dev inverted on enterprise_value with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.55.
Core idea: higher operating_income per unit capex signals efficient capital use. Used both fields with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.68.
Core idea: higher cashflow relative to receivables implies better collection and liquidity. Used two fields with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Gross Profit Stability vs Peers (zscore of gp growth)
results.description: Core idea: consistent gp growth indicates pricing power. Used gp with ts_delta and zscore after ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Did not use group ops to respect KEEP_IN_MIND4. Confidence 0.66.
Core idea: reducing short-term debt improves liquidity. Used debt_st with ts_backfill and ts_delta then reversed to prefer reductions. SUGGESTION4: debt_st has robust counts. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Operating Income to Market Cap (opinc / enterprise_value) zscore
results.description: Core idea: per-market valuation of operating power. Used operating_income and enterprise_value with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3 & SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.8.

Core idea: detecting recoveries using last_diff_value on eps (returns last different eps value) signals turning points. ts_backfill applied to eps (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION2 not used. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Return on Assets Acceleration (ts_delta of return_assets)
results.description: Core idea: accelerating ROA is predictive. Used return_assets with ts_backfill and ts_delta per SUGGESTION3. High userCount supports signal (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.74.
Core idea: firms with high cashflow_op relative to debt can de-lever or return capital. Used both fields backfilled and zscore normalized (SUGGESTION3 & SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.77.
Core idea: if today's EBIT is at recent minimum and rebounds, expect mean-reversion. Used ts_arg_min on backfilled ebit (SUGGESTION3). Kept implementation simple. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Sales vs Inventory Ratio Stability (low std dev)
results.description: Core idea: stable sales/inventory ratio indicates steady demand. Computed ratio then inverted ts_std_dev; ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Capital Expenditure Pullback Favor (reverse ts_delta of capex)
results.description: Core idea: sustained capex reduction can lead to higher cash returns. Used ts_delta and reverse on capex with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Normalized Operating Income per Share Rank
results.description: Core idea: cross-sectional ts_rank of operating_income per share. Used operating_income and shares outstanding with ts_backfill and ts_rank (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.69.
Core idea: positive deviation from historical mean ROIC signals improvement. Used ts_av_diff on ratio with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.73.

results.idea: Earnings Momentum vs Volatility (ts_ir of niadj)
results.description: Core idea: high IR of niadj indicates consistent earnings momentum. Used ts_ir on backfilled niadj (SUGGESTION3 & SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: Enterprise Value Decline (ts_delta EV negative is buy signal)
results.description: Core idea: falling EV with stable fundamentals can be a value opportunity. Used enterprise_value with ts_backfill and reverse ts_delta (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.52.
Core idea: cross-sectional rank of recent sales acceleration. Used sales_ps with ts_backfill and ts_rank (SUGGESTION3). Simplicity maintained for clarity. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Capex to EBITDA Decline (positive if dropping)
results.description: Core idea: decreasing capex/ebitda frees cash. Used capex and ebitda with ts_backfill and ts_delta on ratio (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.6.
Core idea: rising opinc/sales ratio signals margin expansion. Used operating_income and sales_ps with ts_zscore on ratio after ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.72.

Core idea: steady retained_earnings growth signals internal reinvestment. Used retained_earnings with ts_delta and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4 supports retained_earnings field. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Inventory to COGS Improvement (reverse ts_delta of inv/cogs)
results.description: Core idea: falling inventory/cogs ratio implies better turnover. Used inventory and cogs with ts_backfill and reverse ts_delta (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Cashflow Consistency vs Sales (low std dev of cashflow_op/sales)
results.description: Core idea: consistent cashflow relative to sales is high quality. Computed ratio then inverted ts_std_dev with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Earnings Momentum vs Market Cap (niadj / enterprise_value)
results.description: Core idea: earnings relative to market cap is a yield-like value metric. Used niadj and enterprise_value with ts_backfill and zscore (SUGGESTION3 & SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.76.

results.idea: Return on Assets Rank (cross-sectional zscore of ROA)
results.description: Core idea: zscored return_assets identifies top ROA stocks. ts_backfill applied due to coverage (SUGGESTION3). SUGGESTION4: return_assets strong. Confidence 0.8.
Core idea: low kurtosis of operating_income suggests steady distribution; used ts_kurtosis inverted with ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.5.
